q: Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
h:
“Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company. ” —
George Washington

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
h:
“No matter what happens, always be yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Even a hare will bite when it is cornered.
h:
“Even a hare will bite when it is cornered. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Remember where you came from, where you're going, and why you created this mess you got yourself into in the first place.
h:
“Remember where you came from, where you're going, and why you created this mess you got yourself into in the first place.” —
Richard Bach

q: To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.
h:
“To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.” —
Aristotle

q: Failure is the highway to success.
h:
“Failure is the highway to success.” —
Og Mandino

q: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.
h:
“It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.” —
Tony Robbins

q: All men are equal before fish.
h:
“All men are equal before fish.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
h:
“The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
h:
“Believe you can and you're halfway there.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
h:
“Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.” —
Anne Frank

q: Leave the beaten track behind occasionally and dive into the woods. Every time you do you will be certain to find something you have never seen before.
h:
“Leave the beaten track behind occasionally and dive into the woods. Every time you do you will be certain to find something you have never seen before.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
h:
“The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
h:
“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” —
Mark Twain

q: Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.
h:
“Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.” —
Barack Obama

q: In order to be walked over, you have to be lying down.
h:
“In order to be walked over, you have to be lying down.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Open your mind before your mouth.
h:
“Open your mind before your mouth.” —
Aristophanes

q: When one door closes another door opens.
h:
“When one door closes another door opens. ” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
h:
“Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
h:
“Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The deeper the truth in a creative work, the longer it will live.
h:
“The deeper the truth in a creative work, the longer it will live. ” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
h:
“When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
h:
“Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The grass is greener where you water it.
h:
“The grass is greener where you water it.” —
Neil Barringham

q: Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.
h:
“Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.” —
James Allen

q: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
h:
“Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
h:
“The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph. ” —
George Washington

q: Forgive those who have hurt you.
h:
“Forgive those who have hurt you.” —
Les Brown

q: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.
h:
“Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.” —
Euripides

q: Every drop in the ocean counts.
h:
“Every drop in the ocean counts. ” —
Yoko Ono

q: Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.
h:
“Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
h:
“No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.” —
James Allen

q: When a man is penalized for honesty he learns to lie.
h:
“When a man is penalized for honesty he learns to lie.” —
Criss Jami

q: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
h:
“If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.” —
Mark Twain

q: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
h:
“We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.” —
Barack Obama

q: What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.
h:
“What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The way out is in.
h:
“The way out is in.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Desire is suffering.
h:
“Desire is suffering.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: To live is to be willing to die over and over again.
h:
“To live is to be willing to die over and over again.” —
Pema Chodron

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
h:
“The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.” —
Alfred Adler

q: A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.
h:
“A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.” —
Dogen

q: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
h:
“Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
h:
“Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
h:
“Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages. ” —
George Washington

q: A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.
h:
“A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.
h:
“Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
h:
“Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.
h:
“Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.” —
Vaclav Havel
